alert.note: Alert for Pike; Ralls (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 4:32PM CDT until March 31 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL RALLS COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN MISSOURI... NORTHEASTERN AUDRAIN COUNTY IN CENTRAL MISSOURI AND WEST CENTRAL PIKE COUNTIES IN NORTHEASTERN MISSOURI... At 432 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Spencerburg, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Vandalia and Curryville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and northeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
